citations.narrative:
**A review of facility records indicated twelve (12) 7-week-old turkeys were found deceased in the floor pen. The water
line to the pen was found to have disconnected from the pressure reducing valve allowing water to flow freely. The floor
pen did have a drain; however, the plug in the drain had small holes which did not allow the water to drain quickly enough
to adequately remove water from the pen. The facility attributed the death of the birds to the defective water line and
inadequate drainage.
**The defective water line in addition to the inadequate drain, did not protect the birds from injury resulting in a negative
impact to the health of the animals.
**Facilities housing animals should be maintained to be in good repair to prevent harm and injury to the animals.
**Corrective measures were implemented prior to the inspection.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
**The principal investigator of study protocol 2027-02 failed to communicate unexpected morbidity and mortality findings
to the attending veterinarian. On August 26, 2024, the attending veterinarian was notified by an animal caretaker of 9
dead birds. The necropsy findings indicated these birds were dehydrated. Further investigation revealed that the principal
investigator euthanized 3 birds on August 25, 2024, without notifying the attending veterinarian, as the facility’s protocol
required. The failure to timely communicate animal health issues to the attending veterinarian delayed treatment thus
causing undue pain and distress to those animals. An effective method of direct and frequent communication with the
attending veterinarian must be established for timely diagnosis and adequate veterinary intervention.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Debra Sime, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
Lemnique Wafer, Assistant Director n
